alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 7:51PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Idaho, including the following county, Fremont. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 747 PM MDT, Though heavy rain has ended, ponding of water remains. Flooding is ongoing and will take some time to drain. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ashton, Marysville, Ashton Reservoir, Warm River, Ashton Hill and Mesa Falls State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please do not use any roads that are closed. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
